body.name: Pipishell Drywall TV Wall Mount, Studless Wall Mount TV Bracket for 37-75 inch TVs, Holds up to 100 lbs, No Stud or Drilling Required, Easy Install on Drywall with Included Hardware, PILL1
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 3 hrs 11 mins
features: Wide Compatibility: This TV wall mount by Pipishell is compatible with most 37″ to 75″ TVs up to 100 lbs with VESA mounting patterns 200x100 to 600x400mm. Please note that the TV mount is designed exclusively for drywall installation and is not suitable for brick, block, or concrete wall mounting.

Upgraded Security Features: The TV wall mount is built to last with a strong dual-layer wall plate, anti-drop end caps, and pull cord security locks for peace of mind. The wall plate has cushioned backing to avoid damage to your walls while still providing maximum stability.

Super Easy Installation: This low-profile TV mount is easy to install without any wood studs or drilling required. Simply secure the 25″ bracket to the wall using the included nails, then hang your TV with the pull cord security latches and bumpers attached.

Enjoy the Low-Profile Look: Our wall mount TV bracket features a low-profile design that holds your TV only 1.2″ from the wall for a streamlined look. This low-profile TV wall mount is the perfect way to blend a TV screen into your room décor without taking up too much space.

U.S.-Based Product Support: You can depend on Pipishell for quality solutions that both simplify and enhance your entertainment setup. Feel free to contact our friendly U.S.-based product support team if you have any questions about TV wall mount installation or product selection.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Pipishell No Stud TV Wall Mount | Mount Your Screen Without Drilling The PILL1 65 inch TV wall mount drywall is designed to simplify TV mount installation while still offering reliable strength and stability for your television. You can count on Pipishell to provide a studless TV wall mount that will keep your TV secure on the wall for many years to come.
Previous page Next page 1 Purchase Tips 2 Product Dimensions 3 Fits TVs Size & Max Load 4 Compatiable TV Vesa Range 5 Installation Notes

Elevating TV Security to New Heights Previous page Next page Our 65 inch TV wall mount features enhanced security with a dual-layer wall plate, anti-drop end caps, and pull cord locking mechanisms that make installation a breeze. Enjoy peace of mind knowing that this TV mount is built to last with superior materials and construction.

Quick & Easy Installation for no stud TV wall mount PILL1 Mounting the Pipishell studless TV wall mount is almost as easy as hanging a picture frame. Simply secure the wall plate with nails, then hang your TV with the pull cord latches and bumpers attached. No studs or drilling is required to get your TV mounted on the drywall surface.

Upgrade your bedroom TV setup by installing this TV mount in the perfect viewing location on the wall. Create a more relaxing space where you can watch your favorite movies or shows from the comfort of your bed without straining to see a screen that is positioned too low.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easiest television mount
reviews.reviewText: This was the easiest install ever!!! I read some reviews about the level not being up to par but mine was fine as you can see in the picture and I had a backup just incase!! I did use all screws because I was quite skeptical lol but I hung on it before I put it up and I way a good 190 lbs!!..great product only took 10-15 min tops to put up!! I definitely will buy again..oh not to mention I bought two 😂

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install.
reviews.reviewText: I mounted my 55" tv above my fireplace. It has been on the mantle for a year. I like being able to put plants and other items on the mangle under the tv. Mounting the bracket was very easy. Putting the tv on I needed help because it was too big to handle on my own.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Seems to be sturdy.
reviews.reviewText: I have mixed feelings about this tv wall mount. On one hand this was the simplest and easiest tv wall mount I have ever installed, but it also looks questionable in its ability to hold up the weight of the tv. The installation process was super easy. All I had to do was find where I want to install the tv and start hammering the tv mount into place. The trick part was leveling the mount and the rest was a piece of cake. I didn’t know what to do after it was installed because in the back of my mind I couldn’t believe how quick and easy it could be because I was used to using the traditional tv mounts where you have to find the studs and drill some holes for the anchors and stuff. I haven’t up my 65” tv yet as I have read some reviews of other branded stud less mounts failing on people. I’m planing on mounting an older 49” tv on it first to see how well it holds up. Hopefully things go well and I can actually install my 65” tv soon after. Will try to update if something catastrophic happens to my tv.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected !!
reviews.reviewText: Not familiar with this type of TV support before but gladly surprised with the easy installation. I got it for a 50” TV with no issues so far. Many nails to distribute the weight but very easy to patch if having to remove it one day.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 10 minutes install, 65" TV hangs on it perfectly
reviews.reviewText: Amazingly simple idea with solid implementation. New LCD TVs are in the range of 20 to 40 pounds (for 75") and this claims to hold up to 100lbs. So, go figure 🤪Installation is super easy and straightforward, TV is almost flush with the wall. Let's how it holds going forward 👍

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Too many screws needed to hang.
reviews.reviewText: The bracket is nice and light-weight but it takes over 20 screws to attach to the wall. I didn’t like the idea of putting so many holes in my wall. Feasible option but think about whether the installation works for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Versatile flat TV mount. Mount with or without studs.
reviews.reviewText: I used this to mount a 50 inch TV in our bedroom. It was very easy to mount and I'm confident my TV won't fall down. It's well built and takes the least amount of space behind the TV.I appreciate the option to mount without needing to find wall studs. It's good to know that you'll likely find studs during the installation. Here is why. Basically the TV mount would have you hammer in about 2 dozen nails in the mount. Each nail helps add strength in the absence of studs, so it does not fall from the wall. Most houses have studs every 16 inches. Since the mount has you putting a nail almost every inch, you'l likely hit a few studs along the way. I just found my studs and used screws to mount his thing instead. Worked great and I put less holes in my wall.Here is a tip, find how high and where on the wall you want it. Hammer in 1 nail, then level it perfectly and put in another nail several inches away from the first one. Then finish mounting it how you like. Be sure the thing is perfectly level, so that you TV will also be level.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Suprisingly Holds Well
reviews.reviewText: First things first. It's a lot of nails to install. Use this for my 43" TV and it's nice. Very low profile mount and easy to install. It's a love/hate situation with the nails. It's a lot. And when I actually leveled this thing, once I hammered the first nail, the whole mount moved down, so I had to adjust again. This keps happening a lot the first few nails. I would recommend to hold this mount really hard when you're hammering those first few nails. Other than that, the work con for me is that it's hard to full drive the nail in cause you start hitting the mount instead. Maybe im just using a big hammer, but that annoyed me a lot. ended up not fully hammering some of the nails.
